title: Conservation of momentum - person on raft

content.question: A person with mass <math alttext="80 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> stands on a raft with mass <math alttext="15 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> that is initially rest on a still pond. The person begins to walk forward on the raft with a speed of <math alttext="positive 0.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>, as shown. What will the resulting velocity of the raft be as the person walks forward?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
